creditline: Gift of Henry White Cannon, Jr.,Class of 1910, in memory of his Father

texts.textentryhtml: Andrea Monga (1794-1861), Verona; By descent to his son, Cav. Pietro Monga (?-?), Verona; Purchased from him by Jean Paul Richter (1847-1937) in Verona in May 1886; Purchased from him by Henry White Cannon (1850-1934) in Florence on March 10, 1906; By descent to his son, Henry (Harry) W. Cannon, Jr. (1887-1966), Class of 1910; Donated to the Museum in 1935.

bibliography.boilertext: Frank Jewett Mather, Jr., "A fragment by Montegna: a problem in reconstruction", Art in America 31, no. 1 (Jan., 1943): p. 21-26.

caption: School of Andrea Mantegna (Italian, 1431–1506), Virgin and Child. Oil on canvas; 50.8 x 40.7 cm, 67.2 × 55.5 × 4.5 cm (frame). Gift of Henry White Cannon, Jr.,Class of 1910, in memory of his Father (y1935-53)
